items.sentence: Tom couldn\'t find the kind of job he wanted.
I heard someone tell Tom about what happened.
I want to stay in Boston for a few more days.
Tom is just doing what he\'s been told to do.
I think we should consider the problem again.
One of my daughters is married to a Canadian.
One thing I hate about Boston is the traffic.
Tom is the one who showed Mary around Boston.
Tom tried to warn you that this would happen.
Tom usually helps me with this kind of thing.
Tom visited not only Boston but Chicago, too.
Tom is prepared for anything that may happen.
Tom is probably going to go to Boston by car.
Tom is responsible for what happened to Mary.
Tom ran too fast for me to catch up with him.
Tom ran too fast for us to catch up with him.
Tom realized that Mary had been lying to him.
Have you ever thought about moving to Boston?
I thought you said that you didn\'t eat meat.
I thought you said that you didn\'t like Tom.
Tom was still asleep when Mary left for work.
I can\'t tell if you\'re being honest or not.
The only book Tom has ever read is the Bible.
The police are supposed to serve and protect.
How long are you planning on being in Boston?
How long does it take to the station by taxi?
Tom and Mary said they didn\'t want to fight.
There are a lot of places to visit in Boston.
There are a lot of things I want to do today.
I don\'t want you getting hurt because of me.
You have to do it even if you don\'t want to.
Tom looked like he wasn\'t feeling very well.
Tom knew Mary didn\'t really want to do that.
Tom doesn\'t find this as funny as Mary does.
It seems like your only choice is to do that.
I\'m waiting for Tom to get back from Boston.
Tom said he\'d call back as soon asÂ he could.
Tom says he\'s too tired to do any more work.
Tom couldn\'t go to John and Mary\'s wedding.
There\'s only one thing we still need to buy.
Come over here and warm yourself by the fire.
Could I have a moment alone with Tom, please?
You\'re a bit younger than I am, aren\'t you?
You\'re a lot older than Tom is, aren\'t you?
You\'re a lot younger than I am, aren\'t you?
I hate to say this, but I think Tom is right.
Tom didn\'t let his children go out at night.
Tom didn\'t need to use the knife I lent him.
Tom read every book in his school\'s library.
Tom said Mary could\'ve done that by herself.
